title: In-House Print Studio Build
tagline: Building a self-sufficient creative production pipeline

context.problem: Outsourced vendors were expensive, slow, and inconsistent. Turnarounds for wraps, apparel, and signage often delayed campaigns and installations.
constraints: Limited space for equipment and materials
Need to train seasonal staff annually
Must maintain quality while scaling volume
context.quote: We needed creative control and speed. Outsourcing was holding us back.

solution.approach: Built complete in-house print and apparel studio from scratch using HP Latex printer, developed standardized production workflows, created templates, and trained staff for large-format printing and apparel production.
bullets: Implemented HP Latex 315 printer and cutting systems
Developed production workflows from design to installation
Created standardized templates for fleet wraps and signage
Designed and produced custom apparel for 120+ employees
Trained seasonal staff on print and application techniques

gallery.caption: Custom standee print detail and quality

process.title: Equipment Setup
process.description: Install HP Latex 315 and supporting tools

process.title: Workflow Design
process.description: Document processes from design to installation

process.title: Production
process.description: Execute fleet wraps, signage, and apparel projects

process.title: Staff Training
process.description: Develop training materials and onboard team

reflection.learning: Bringing production in-house isn't just about cost—it's about control, speed, and quality. Build the system, then scale it.
